info.name: Ecommerce API
info.description:
An API for ecommerce works built using NodeJS & MongoDB

Contact Support:
 Name: Mahmoud Yasser
 Email: mle.mahmoud.yasser@gmail.com

item.name: auth
login
This route allow you to login into the api

request.description: This route allow you to login into the api

response.name: User data with access token and refresh token

item.name: register
This route allow you to sign up into the api

item.name: logout
This route allow you to logout from the api

request.description: This route allow you to logout from the api

response.name: Logout from the api using you refresh token.

item.name: tokens
This route allow the user with a refresh token to regenerate tokens when the access token expires

request.description: This route allow the user with a refresh token to regenerate tokens when the access token expires

response.name: Regenerate tokens and use them to log into the system again.

item.name: forgot-password
This route allow you to send email with the reset password link to reset the password you forgot

request.description: This route allow you to send email with the reset password link to reset the password you forgot

response.name: A link is going now to be sent to you email to reset you password.

item.name: reset-password
This route allow you to reset you password using the token you received in you email

query.description: (Required)

request.description: This route allow you to reset you password using the token you received in you email

response.name: Reset you password using the reset token.

query.description: (Required)
(Required)

item.name: This route allow you to get all users data

query.description: This will filter all users and select only user that contain the word you insert and search in all user fields about this word
Select only fields you want.
Limit the number of users from for example 20 user to 5 users.
Sorting users according to specified field for example the name field, and the number before the field name indicates the order of items: descending (-1) or ascending (1)
When number of user is greater than 10 users, it divides into pages each page contain 10 users.
